title: PM Modi strikes defiant ‘Make in India’ note in face of Trump’s tariff
content: Amidst global economic instability and US tariff threats, Prime Minister Modi has strongly advocated for boosting domestic consumption, emphasizing the 'Make in India' initiative. Despite US pressure, India hasn't halted Russian oil imports, prioritizing its economic interests. India defends its long-standing ties with Russia, asserting independent foreign policy.

title: 'Should be very cautious': Russia 'attentive' to Trump's nuclear 'rhetoric'; cites NPT
content: The Kremlin has urged caution following Donald Trump's announcement of deploying two nuclear submarines closer to Russia. This action was a response to Dmitry Medvedev's provocative statements regarding nuclear capabilities. Trump emphasized the deployment as a precaution, highlighting the US's readiness to protect its people amidst escalating tensions and potential new sanctions against Russia.

title: Chris Woakes ready to bat left-handed if needed in Oval decider
content: England's Chris Woakes is ready to bat left-handed if needed in the final Test against India, despite a shoulder injury sustained on Day 3. Joe Root lauded Woakes' commitment, comparing it to Rishabh Pant's courageous batting with a leg injury earlier in the series. England are chasing 374, with the match poised for a dramatic finish on Day 5.

title: Shibu Soren passes away: PM Modi pays tribute, consoles Hemant at hospital
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Shibu Soren, the late Jharkhand leader and former Chief Minister, at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi. Soren, 81, had been battling kidney ailments. Modi met with Chief Minister Hemant Soren and family, expressing condolences. President Murmu and Governor Gangwar also mourned Soren's death, recognizing his contributions to social justice and tribal rights.

title: Bill Gates: AI can replace complex coding, but it's not fully there yet
content: Bill Gates believes AI is rapidly advancing, capable of handling simple coding tasks but not yet the most complex ones. Experts disagree on whether AI will master complex coding within two years or a decade. Gates highlights AI's potential to replace telesales jobs, impacting various sectors.

title: SpiceJet staffer assaulted by army officer says he 'can't move his back'
content: A SpiceJet ground staffer in Srinagar recounts being violently assaulted by an Indian Army officer over excess baggage, resulting in spinal fractures. The staffer emphasizes he was simply doing his duty when the officer, Lt. Col. R.K. Singh, allegedly attacked him and other colleagues after a dispute over baggage fees.

title: 'If a statue can enter, why not a cow?': Shankaracharya criticises Parl inauguration
content: Shankaracharya Avimukteshwaranand advocated for a living cow's presence during the new Parliament building's inauguration, emphasizing its blessing. He urged Maharashtra to establish a cow felicitation protocol and proposed "Ramadhams"—cow shelters—in each constituency, rewarding caretakers financially. He supported declaring the cow as "Rashtramata" and demanded a complete ban on cow slaughter, criticizing the government's Amrit Kaal celebrations amidst ongoing slaughter.

title: Elon Musk: Many top engineers of Meta are joining my AI company xAI, and I am paying them...
content: Elon Musk claims his AI startup, xAI, is attracting Meta engineers without exorbitant salaries, emphasizing its merit-based culture and growth potential. This comes amid reports of Meta's aggressive AI talent acquisition, fueled by CEO Mark Zuckerberg's push to build a top-tier team for its Superintelligence Labs.

title: Drunk army constable drives onto Meerut railway platform
content: An Army constable was arrested in Meerut Cantt for allegedly driving his car onto a railway platform while intoxicated. The incident, captured in a widely circulated video, shows the car dangerously close to a passing train. Railway police intervened, confirming the constable's intoxication through a medical examination.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ crosses Rs 300 cr in India but slows as ‘Mahavtar Narsimha’ takes lead
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has crossed ₹300 crore in India after a successful run, despite competition from 'Mahavtar Narsimha' and new releases. The film earned ₹6.75 crore and ₹8 crore on its third Saturday and Sunday, respectively.

title: 'Siraj will be remembered ... ': Will dropped catch of Brook haunt him?
content: Mohammad Kaif believes Mohammed Siraj's dropped catch of Harry Brook could prove costly in the final Test, though his overall bowling performance might overshadow the error. Ricky Ponting echoed this sentiment, highlighting the potential expense of the missed opportunity. Ravi Shastri anticipates the drop will motivate Siraj, while acknowledging Brook's aggressive batting style shifted the momentum towards England.

title: Google DeepMind CEO on AI in healthcare: Doctors at risk; Nurses remain essential
content: AI is rapidly transforming industries, raising concerns about job displacement. Tech leaders like Amazon's Andy Jassy and Nvidia's Jensen Huang acknowledge potential job losses due to automation, while also anticipating new opportunities. Google DeepMind's Demis Hassabis predicts significant workplace changes within the next decade, emphasizing the need for reskilling and collaboration between humans and AI.

title: Tejashwi's dual voter ID row: Lawyer files complaint
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav faces a police complaint filed by an advocate in Patna regarding his alleged possession of two EPICs. This action follows a notice from the Election Commission of India, which discovered discrepancies in Yadav's stated EPIC numbers.

title: Over 3,000 Boeing fighter jet workers went on strike; here's why
content: More than 3,200 Boeing workers initiated a strike due to disagreements over a new contract. The workers rejected Boeing's offer, citing concerns about wages, job security, and benefits. The strike impacts production of military aircraft like the F-15 and F/A-18. Union leaders emphasize the need for fair compensation and respect for workers. Boeing expressed disappointment and implemented contingency plans.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Hope it doesn't come down to ... ' - Nasser Hussain warns England ahead of letting Chris Woakes bat
content: The Test series heads into its final morning with England at 339/6, needing 35 runs to win. India requires four wickets to level the series. Chris Woakes' shoulder injury gives India the opportunity to exploit it if he is needed to come and bat. Joe Root and Harry Brook scored centuries for England. Prasidh Krishna took three wickets for India.

title: Guns, gangs & minors: ‘Lady Don’ Zikra chargesheeted in Seelampur teen murder case
content: Delhi Police have filed a chargesheet against Zikra, infamously known as 'Lady Don,' and seven others concerning the murder of a 17-year-old boy in Seelampur. The charges include murder and criminal conspiracy. Zikra, associated with the Mastan gang, allegedly groomed teenagers for criminal activities.

title: 'It will be dramatic, but ... ' - Michael Vaughan's bold prediction ahead of series finale
content: Michael Vaughan predicts a dramatic finish to the England-India Test series as England needs 35 runs with limited wickets. Harry Brook's century and Root's ton put England in a strong position, but a late Indian fightback has kept the match alive. The final day promises high tension with India looking to level the series.

title: 'Past mistakes ... ': Ex-India cricketer on IND vs ENG Day 4 pressure battle
content: Former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar highlighted the intense pressure India exerted on England's batters during the final session of Day 4 in the fifth Test. Despite centuries from Root and Brook, India's seamers triggered a late collapse, leaving England at 339/6, needing 35 more runs.

title: Pak IDs, chocolates: 3 killed in Op Mahadev were Lashkar operatives behind Pahalgam attack
content: Security agencies have confirmed that the three terrorists killed after the Pahalgam attack were Pakistani nationals, providing irrefutable evidence including government documents and biometric data. The Lashkar-e-Taiba operatives were responsible for the April 22 attack that claimed 26 lives. Recovered items and forensic analysis further solidify Pakistan's direct involvement in the deadly incident.

title: Meat twice a month, Rs 540 per day: What awaits Prajwal Revanna in Bengaluru prison
content: Prajwal Revanna, formerly earning Rs 1.2 lakh monthly as an MP, now faces a stark reality as inmate no. 15528 in Bengaluru Central Prison, where his potential earnings are capped at Rs 540 per month. Awaiting his work assignment, he will adhere to prison routines, including a fixed menu and limited phone calls and visitation.

title: 'True Indian won't make such statement': SC slams Rahul over Army remark
content: The Supreme Court criticized Rahul Gandhi for his alleged defamatory remarks against the Indian Army, stating that a true Indian wouldn't make such statements. While staying the defamation case, the court questioned Gandhi about the basis of his claim that China occupied 2000 km of Indian land.

title: Countering Trump tariff impact: Govt wants exporters to promote homegrown brands
content: Faced with a 25% US tariff, the Indian government is urging exporters to develop domestic brands and is considering measures like reduced testing fees for smaller exporters. The focus is on sectors like marine products, which now face increased competition. The government is also exploring employment-linked programs and fixed-price intermediate products to support exporters.

title: 'Certified anti-national': BJP's Amit Malviya accuses Rahul of foreign ties
content: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya has branded Rahul Gandhi a "certified anti-national" following Supreme Court criticism of Gandhi's remarks about the Indian Army. Malviya accused Gandhi of seeking foreign support, engaging with China against national interests, and undermining India's image abroad.

title: Exclusive | 'Very surprising': Indian World Junior Champ's Grand Swiss entry has a wild backstory
content: In a surprise twist, India’s 2025 World Junior Champion Pranav Venkatesh has earned a wildcard entry to the prestigious 2025 FIDE Grand Swiss after defeating Kazakhstan’s GM Kazybek Nogerbek 1.5–0.5 in an unpublicised 'Asian Wildcard Match' in Al Ain, UAE. Pranav, who narrowly missed qualifying by rating, now joins an elite field chasing a spot in the 2026 Candidates.

title: Cockroaches found in San Francisco-Mumbai Air India flight; airline apologises
content: Air India has initiated an investigation following passenger complaints about cockroaches on flight AI180 from San Francisco to Mumbai. The incident, which occurred during the long-haul journey, prompted the airline to relocate affected passengers and conduct a thorough cleaning during a scheduled stop in Kolkata. Air India has apologized for the inconvenience and is working to prevent future occurrences.

title: Malegaon blast verdict: Shankaracharya says 'don't link terrorism with colour'
content: The acquittal of all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case has reignited the debate over the term 'Saffron Terror.' Shankaracharya Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati Maharaj condemned linking color with terrorism, emphasizing that a terrorist is simply a terrorist. Political figures have weighed in, with some rejecting the term while others suggest alternatives like 'Hindu fundamentalist' or 'Hindu terrorism.'

title: Watch: 20-foot-long whale killed after boat collision; passenger thrown overboard
content: A tragic incident occurred in Barnegat Bay. A boat struck a minke whale on Saturday. The impact fatally injured the whale. A passenger was thrown into the water. The Marine Mammal Stranding Center responded to the scene. Authorities plan to move the whale for a necropsy. The incident sparked concern on social media.

title: ‘They’ll take us to Bangladesh’: Kolkata man hangs self over 'NRC-SIR' anxiety
content: Dilip Kumar Saha, a 63-year-old man who migrated from Bangladesh to Bengal in 1972, was found dead at his home. His family alleges that Saha's extreme anxiety over NRC and SIR led him to suicide, fueled by fears of being deported.

title: 'Education only way': Kamal Haasan's plan to defeat 'Sanatan, dictatorship'
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kamal Haasan emphasized the importance of education as the key to dismantling "dictatorship and Sanatan" during an Agaram Foundation event in Chennai. He cautioned against relying on other methods, asserting that education is essential for true victory, as an uninformed majority could undermine progress.

title: Beed scare: Lift carrying Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange, his supporters crashes
content: Maratha reservation activist Manoj Jarange and his supporters experienced a harrowing incident in Beed when an elevator they were in plummeted from the first floor of a private hospital. Fortunately, no injuries were reported as those inside the lift activated the emergency button and were successfully rescued.

title: 3 political reasons for current India-US trade stalemate
content: Donald Trump's imposition of 25% tariffs on India, despite ongoing trade talks, stems from political motives, according to SBI Research. The report highlights Trump's declining approval ratings and concerns over India's firm stance on sovereignty. The US administration's crypto push, Pakistan's digital currency ambitions, and India's growing BRICS partnership are also factors.

title: Nearly 200,000 kitchen set toys recalled after one reported death; experts share safety tips for parents
content: A tragic incident involving a KidKraft “Farm to Table” play kitchen led to a recall of nearly 192,000 units after a toddler's death. The child suffocated when their shirt became entangled on a hook. Parents are urged to stop using the kitchens, remove the original hooks, and request free replacements to prevent further accidents.

title: Congress MP R Sudha's chain snatched in Delhi during morning walk
content: Congress MP R Sudha was robbed of her gold chain during a morning walk in Delhi's high-security Chanakyapuri area. The incident occurred near the Poland Embassy, raising concerns about safety in the national capital. Sudha sustained injuries and expressed shock over the attack, urging authorities to apprehend the culprit immediately.

title: Rajasthan police’s public parade: Heads shaved, made to wear salwar suits
content: In Rajasthan's Merta, three men accused of swindling an elderly man were paraded through town dressed in women's clothing, chanting admissions of guilt. This public shaming tactic, increasingly used by Rajasthan police against organized and financial crimes, aims to deter potential offenders and reassure the public.

title: Woakes could bat with one arm against India – just like Malik in '86
content: In a dramatic turn at The Oval, injured Chris Woakes has declared himself available to bat for England in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy's final day. Despite a painful shoulder injury, Woakes is prepared to bat at No.11 if needed to secure the remaining 35 runs for a series victory against India.

title: China resists US pressure to curb Russian, Iranian oil buys
content: US and China are engaged in tough trade negotiations, with a major sticking point being China's oil imports from Iran and Russia. China insists on maintaining its energy supply routes, defying US pressure to cease these purchases. Despite this disagreement, both sides express optimism about reaching a deal to stabilize commercial ties, although significant challenges remain.

title: IND vs ENG | Vaughan: 'If Stokes is injured in the future, Pope can stay as vice-captain'
content: Michael Vaughan suggests Harry Brook as a potential future England Test captain, impressed by his natural leadership qualities displayed on the field. Vaughan believes Brook could be a better fit than current vice-captain Ollie Pope, even though Pope is a great support to the captain. Brook's prior experience captaining England's white-ball team further strengthens Vaughan's argument.

title: Colon cancer rising in young adults; US doctor lists 4 fruits to cut risk
content: Recent studies highlight a concerning rise in colon cancer among younger adults, prompting experts to emphasize preventive lifestyle changes. Consuming fruits like watermelon, apples, kiwi, and citrus, rich in fiber and antioxidants, can significantly reduce the risk. Alongside a plant-rich diet, regular exercise, weight management, and limited alcohol intake are crucial for prevention.

title: IND vs ENG Test: 'He reminded me of Rishabh Pant' - Ex-India cricketer
content: Ajay Jadeja lauded Harry Brook's impactful batting style, drawing comparisons to Rishabh Pant due to their similar aggressive approach and the tendency for their bats to fly. Brook's aggressive innings, featuring a rapid scoring burst and a century, shifted the momentum for England.

title: NSDL IPO allotment today: How to check status, key dates- All you need to know
content: NSDL's Rs 4,011.60-crore IPO witnessed overwhelming investor response, oversubscribed 41.02 times and priced at Rs 800 per share. With listing scheduled on BSE, grey market premiums indicate a strong debut. The IPO, an Offer for Sale, aims to unlock shareholder value, attracting significant interest due to NSDL's strong financials and market position.

title: How Bijan Robinson and Christian McCaffrey are forming a competitive bond
content: Along with Luke McCaffrey, the players shared tips about performance and recovery during offseason workouts.

title: NFLPA elects White as interim executive director
content: The NFL Players Association on Sunday night elected David White as its interim executive director, 17 days after the resignation of Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Young wins elusive 1st PGA Tour title at Wyndham
content: Cameron Young finally got his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after seven runner-up finishes, coasting to a 2-under 68 to win the Wyndham Championship.

title: Lyles stare-down, Bednarek shove cap tense 200m
content: The U.S. track championships turned physical Sunday, with Noah Lyles and Kenny Bednarek getting involved in a shoving and shouting match as they crossed the finish line of a hotly contested 200-meter final.

title: Miami says Messi injury 'minor,' no return date set
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi suffered a "minor" muscle injury in his right leg Saturday night in the Leagues Cup match against Necaxa at Chase Stadium.

title: Khabib hopes McGregor changes 'how he is living'
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Fins make Sieler their highest-paid defensive player
content: The Dolphins and defensive tackle Zach Sieler agreed to a three-year extension worth up to $67.75 million, making him the team's highest-paid defensive player.

title: Rodriguez makes history with another 20-20 year
content: Julio Rodriguez homered to become the first player in major league history with 20 or more home runs and 20 or more stolen bases in each of his first four seasons.

title: Amorim backs Fernandes' criticism of 'lazy' United
content: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has backed Bruno Fernandes' criticism of the performance in their 2-2 draw with Everton by saying he's happy for his players to call it out if they see a drop in standards.

title: 🏈 Making sense of Terry McLaurin's trade request
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: Ruben Amorim Q&A: 'It's Manchester United; we need to return to Europe'
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim talks to ESPN about changing the club's culture, Alejandro Garnacho's future, and exchanging GIFs with Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review
content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Ramos as Sesko backup
content: Newcastle could turn to PSG's Gonçalo Ramos if their pursuit of Benjamin Sesko stalls. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Karnataka High Court directs transport unions to put strike call on hold for a day
content: A division bench comprising Justice K S Madagal and Justice M.G.S. Kamal passed the order on a PIL petition filed by J. Sunil and others, who are all dependent on public transport for their everyday commute

title: Karnataka High Court directs transport unions to put their strike call on hold for a day
content: A division bench passed the order on a PIL petitions filed by J. Sunil and others, who are all depending on the public transport for their everyday travel.

title: Navies of India, Singapore conclude SIMBEX
content: Annual SIMBEX exercise strengthens naval partnership between RSN and Indian Navy, enhancing operational competencies and mutual understanding

title: 14-year-old student found dead at home in Bengaluru
content: The boy allegedly left behind a note apologising to his family, mentioning his school friends, police said

title: GST evasion of ₹7.08 lakh crore detected in five years, includes input tax credit fraud of ₹1.79 lakh crore
content: In 2024-25 fiscal alone, more than ₹2.23 lakh crore of GST evasion were detected by CGST field officers, according to the data shared by Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary in the Lok Sabha

title: Two more arrested for indecent comments against actor and former MP Ramya in Karnataka
content: Ramya had shared the SC observations regarding the murder of Renukaswamy in which Kannada actor Darshan is among the accused, which attracted the wrath of his fans who allegedly made inappropriate comments

title: ‘Deny, distract, lie, justify’: Congress slams Modi government over 2020 Galwan standoff after Supreme Court raps Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress says the Modi government is responsible for the biggest territorial setback India has faced since 1962; accuses the government of pursuing “normalisation” with China because of its cowardice and misplaced economic priorities

title: Retired judge H.N. Nagmohan Das submits much-awaited recommendations on internal reservation for SCs in Karnataka
content: The report will be discussed by the Cabinet and is likely to be placed before the State Legislature, recommended quota within reservation matrix yet to be disclosed

title: Ungaludan Stalin, Nalam Kaakkum Stalin initiatives: Madras HC to wait for Supreme Court order on naming T.N. government schemes after living personalities
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan adjourn Tamil Nadu government’s modification plea to Thursday since DMK’s appeal is to be heard by the top court on Wednesday

title: Kerala shipwrecks: State to frame Oil Spill Contingency Plan
content: To include mapping of environmental sensitive index of oil spills along coast of Kerala and preparation of response-focussed contingency plans

title: Lok Sabha adjourned for the day as Opposition protests over Bihar SIR continue
content: Ahead of the adjournment, the Chair reminded the Opposition members that since the Monsoon session began, not even a single Bill has been passed by the House due to repeated disruptions

title: Andhra University’s affiliated colleges alerted over ‘fake Intermediate certificates’ submitted for Degree courses
content: The university has taken this decision in the wake of complaints that some candidates are allegedly getting admission in graduate programmes by submitting ‘fake intermediate’ certificates offered by the institutions in States such as Bihar, Uttar Pradesh among others

title: Shibu Soren death: Congress protest against ‘votes theft’ in Bengaluru postponed to August 8
content: The protest was rescheduled as AICC chief Mallikarjun Kharge and Mr. Gandhi have to attend the funeral ceremony of Shibu Soren on August 5 in Jharkhand.

title: Shibu Soren death: President Murmu, Modi, Rahul visit Sir Ganga Ram Hospital to pay homage
content: “Went to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital to pay homage to Shri Shibu Soren Ji. Also met his family. My thoughts are with Hemant Ji, Kalpana Ji and the admirers of Shri Shibu Soren Ji,” PM Modi said

title: Shibu Soren: From a social reformer to an iconic tribal leader
content: He played a crucial role in the creation of the separate state of Jharkhand, turning a long-standing dream into reality

title: Mysuru Dasara 2025: Gajapayana flagged off near Nagarahole forest
content: The event signals the countdown to the Mysuru Dasara, and all activities will revolve around preparations for the annual event, which highlights the culture of Karnataka, and also promotes tourism

title: Two arrested for operating illegal telephone exchange racket in Bengaluru
content: The accused would get the SIM cards from foreign countries by courier and earn around ₹5 lakh per month illegally

title: Madras High Court dismisses plea to initiate process of appointment of T.N. DGP
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan refuse to entertain a PIL plea on the ground that it is premature

title: Nalam Kaakkum Stalin scheme: AIADMK MP C.Ve. Shanmugam files contempt plea against two senior IAS officers in T.N.
content: Says, the two government officials had deliberately disobeyed court orders by launching Nalam Kaakkum Stalin scheme on August 2, 2025

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates VinFast’s first EV manufacturing plant in India at Thoothukudi
content: Highlighting Tamil Nadu’s reputation as a manufacturing powerhouse, Mr. Stalin said, “Chennai is India’s Detroit.” He added that Thoothukudi was also fast emerging as an automotive hub

title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan’s remarks on Kerala govt project for SC/ST filmmakers kick up a storm, complaint filed against him
content: Adoor Gopalakrishnan insists he is ‘not against providing financial assistance to anyone, but beneficiaries should be provided adequate training and orientation before disbursal of funds’

title: Uttarakhand High Court stays scientist’s conviction in abetment of suicide case in ‘larger public interest’
content: The Uttarakhand High Court said that the research of Akash Yadav, the convicted scientist, holds critical value for the society at large

title: Security agencies gather evidence confirming Pakistani nationality of Pahalgam attackers
content: The terrorists crossed the Line of Control through north Kashmir's Gurez sector in May 2022, when the intelligence intercepts placed their radio check-in from the Pakistani side, the officials said

title: Supreme Court agrees to hear DMK’s plea against HC order barring TN govt from using name, picture of CM Stalin in welfare schemes
content: Senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi, appearing for the Tamil Nadu Government, said it has been held by the Supreme Court that the name and pictures of the CM can be used in welfare schemes

title: India, Philippines stage joint sail and naval drill in the disputed South China Sea
content: Armed Forces of the Philippines chief of staff Gen. Romeo Brawner said the two-day joint naval sail and exercises have been successful so far and expressed hopes that Filipino forces could engage India’s military in more joint maneuvers

title: Odisha motor vehicle inspector arrested for corruption; 44 plots, 1 kg gold, among valuables found
content: Golap Chandra Hansdah, working at the RTO in Boudh, was arrested after assets disproportionate to his known sources of income were found in his possession, they said

title: SIR very big issue, government must agree to debate: Priyanka Gandhi
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the opposition should not continue to raise the issue when the matter pertains to voters' list.

title: Absurd to link SIR in Bihar with Tamil Nadu, says Election Commission
content: A post by ECI, seeking to check facts in light of the charges made by former Union Minister P. Chidambaram, said, there was no need for political leaders to spread “false information” with respect to the SIR exercisce being conducted at the national level

title: Karnataka ranks second in EV charging stations on national highways
content: According to data by Ministry of Road Transport & Highways, a total of 4,557 public EV charging stations have been installed across 146,342 km stretch of National Highway across India

title: Takeaways for India from Trump moment: strategic autonomy is alive, neoliberalism is dead
content: Neither obsequiousness nor confrontation can advance India’s relations with the U.S. India should also learn that soft power is supposed to be soft, not loud and screeching

title: Rajya Sabha adjourns for the day as a mark of respect to Shibu Soren’s death
content: Deputy Chairman Harivansh announced Shibu Soren’s death in the Upper House immediately after it convened for the day, and the members observed a minute of silence to mark his death

title: Delivery worker fatally knocked down by private bus at Kalamassery in Kerala
content: He was reportedly on duty and was on his way to pick up a delivery for an online aggregator when his motorcycle was knocked down by private bus

title: Delhi Police’s description of Bengali an insult to language in which national anthem was written: Stalin
content: Ms. Banerjee had stated that a purported communication by the Delhi Police had reportedly referred to Bengali as a “Bangladeshi language”

title: Rahul Gandhi defamation case: Supreme Court stays proceedings; issues notice to State of Uttar Pradesh, complainant
content: “How did you get to know that 2,000 sq km of Indian territory was occupied? Were you there? Do you have any credible proof?” Justice Dipankar Datta criticised Rahul Gandhi

title: 678th Bahmani empire foundation day celebrated in Kalaburagi
content: Sultan Alauddin Hasan Bahman Shah established his capital, Ahsanabad (now Kalaburagi), on August 3, 1347

title: Shibu Soren’s death: Jharkhand Assembly Monsoon Session adjourned sine die
content: Legislators inside the Assembly raised slogans such as ‘Shibu Soren Amar Rahe’ (Long live Shibu Soren) as soon as the House assembled for the day

title: Uttar Pradesh floods: 'Failed' government focussed on event management than public welfare, says Akhilesh Yadav
content: In a post on X, the former Chief Minister said when the State Government can organise "super VVIP" rallies, why has it failed to carry out relief and rescue operations in the flood-affected areas

title: BJP's ally IPFT demands SIR in Tripura
content: The development came days after a delegation of Tipra Motha Party (TMP), another ally of the BJP in Tripura, met Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Gyanesh Kumar and demanded SIR in the State

title: Shibu Soren death: Shibu Soren’s body to be brought to Ranchi in evening, says JMM | LIVE
content: Shibu Soren, who had been admitted to the Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in the national capital for over a month, passed away in a Delhi hospital on August 4, 2025; Jharkhand Government declares three-day State mourning following his demise

title: 43-year-old woman ends life in Hyderabad apartment complex
content: Police recover three letters purportedly written by the victim, one of them mentioning religious customs

title: 22-year-old man arrested for marrying minor, sexual assault in Raichur
content: According to the girl’s statement, the accused committed sexual assault on her twice at his house, despite knowing that she was a minor

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 11 LIVE: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha adjourned for the day
content: Rajya Sabha was adjourned right after convening, as a sign of respect after the demise of Shibu Soren.

title: Shibu Soren, JMM founder and former Jharkhand CM, dies at 81 after prolonged illness
content: Shibu Soren was admitted to the Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in the national capital and was in life support following an illness

title: Eight militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested five active cadres of KCP (PWG) from different locations in Imphal West and East and Bishnupur districts

title: Man held at Mumbai airport with marijuana worth ₹14.73 cr concealed in 'diplomatic' cargo

title: PM Narendra Modi to inaugurate Namma Metro Yellow Line on August 10, lay foundation for Phase 3
content: The Yellow and Orange Lines together will benefit nearly 25 lakh people in Bengaluru South, according to Bangalore South MP Tejasvi Surya

title: Naidu urges Gadkari to give speedy clearance to Vizag and Vijayawada metro rail projects

title: BJP committed to uplift of denotified tribes, says Andhra party president Madhav
content: Stating that these marginalised communities have been subjected to neglect for long, the BJP leader highlights the measures taken by the NDA government at the Centre to restore their identity and dignity

title: Quartz mining brings political rivalry to the fore in Nellore district

title: Family alleges NRC fear behind elderly man’s death in Kolkata
content: The deceased worked as a non-teaching staff member at a private school in south Kolkata. He had arrived in Kolkata in 1972 from Nawabganj in Dhaka

title: Top Trump aide accuses India of financing Russia's war in Ukraine
content: The criticism of India by Stephen Miller, deputy chief of staff at the White House, was one of the strongest yet by the Trump administration

title: Another slip up by India in the trade pact with the U.K.
content: There is a dilution of India’s backing of the more effective compulsory licensing to address the high prices of patented medicines

title: On the track towards belonging
content: More than a feat of engineering, completion of the line is a reaffirmation of a social contract between the people of Kashmir and the Indian Union

title: While in power AIADMK surrendered T.N.’s autonomy by backing Centre’s policies: Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin alleges that the BJP-led government at the Centre allocated meagre funding to Tamil, the first language in India to be recognised as a Classical Language, while allocating several crores of rupees for Sanskrit

title: Delete caste column from appraisal forms: T.N. Police Commission
content: The panel, headed by former Judge of the Madras High Court Justice C.T. Selvam and other senior serving and former bureaucrats, says there is no need for the superior officer appraising the professional work to know the caste of the police personnel

title: Using ‘Bangladeshi for Bangla’ an insult to Bengali culture: Trinamool
content: The Trinamool Congress has been calling for Bengali Asmita over the targeting of migrant workers in BJP ruled states

title: Despite nod from officials, motorable road is still on paper for tribespeople in Marayur
content: Karimutty tribal settlement is just 350 m away from the Munnar-Udumalpet National Highway. There is only a dirt road connecting the NH to the settlement, despite multiple petitions from the tribespeople

title: Philippines President Marcos Jr. to visit India as two sides deepen maritime cooperation

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 11 Highlights: Both Houses Adjourned For The Day

title: "Empowered Tribal Community, Poor": PM Modi Leads Tributes To Shibu Soren
content: Tributes poured in from across the political spectrum on Monday following the death of Shibu Soren, former Jharkhand Chief Minister, and the founder of the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM).

title: Several Areas In Varanasi Flooded As Ganga Overflows Amid Heavy Rain In UP
content: The chief minister has deployed an 11-member ministerial team to oversee relief operations across 12 affected districts, warning that any negligence will not be tolerated and stressing the need for sensitivity, speed and transparency.

title: Too Tired To Escape: Thief Falls Asleep After Robbery, Caught Next Morning
content: In a bizarre incident, a thief who stole from two houses in Kanpur ended up falling asleep in one of the homes he had just looted, only to be caught red-handed by the homeowners the next morning.

title: Cambodia To Nominate Donald Trump For Nobel Peace Prize: What It Means
content: Cambodia will nominate US President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, Deputy Prime Minister Sun Chanthol confirmed on Friday. The announcement follows Trump's reported intervention in ending recent border clashes between Cambodia and Thailand.

title: Smart Cities Start With People, Not Technology: Study
content: African cities are growing at an incredible pace. With this growth comes a mix of opportunity and challenge. How do we build cities that are not only smart but also fair, inclusive and resilient?

title: 76 Migrants Dead, Dozens Missing After Boat Sinks Off Yemen
content: At least 76 people have been killed and dozens are missing after a boat carrying mostly Ethiopian migrants sank off Yemen, in the latest tragedy on the perilous sea route, officials told AFP on Monday.

title: She Asked Him To Destroy Phone, He Kept It. Lover's Mistake Unravels Murder
content: Tired of her criminal husband's repeated assaults under the influence of drugs, a 34-year-old woman plotted his murder. The criminal was killed and his body dumped in a canal in another state

title: "If She's Republican...": Donald Trump Defends Sydney Sweeney's Jeans Ad
content: US President Donald Trump has come out in support of actress Sydney Sweeney and her campaign for the apparel giant American Eagle. He called the advertisement "fantastic" after learning that the actress was a registered Republican.

title: "He Didn't Allow Anyone To Help Me": SpiceJet Staffer Hit By Army Officer
content: Four SpiceJet employees were left with "grievous injuries" after the army officer assaulted them at Srinagar airport on July 26.

title: Adani Group Denies Reports Suggesting Tie-Up With Chinese Company BYD
content: The Adani Group on Monday vehemently denied a media report claiming the Group's collaboration with Chinese companies BYD and Beijing Welion New Energy Technology.

title: South Korea Offers A Rare Glimpse Into Life Of Koreans Displaced By War
content: The Demilitarised Zone on the Ganghwado Island in northwest South Korea offers a rare glimpse into the lives of displaced North Koreans who have been living there for over 70 years.

title: 184 Dead In Himachal Floods, Landslides, 305 National Highways Blocked
content: Of 184 deaths in Himachal during this monsoon, 103 deaths were directly attributed to rain-related causes and 81 linked to road accidents, mostly due to treacherous conditions on hilly terrain and damaged roads.

title: Afghan Passport Racket Busted: Anti-Terrorism Squad Finds Akola Link
content: In a twist to the recently busted inter-state fake passport racket, the communally sensitive city of Akola in Maharashtra has emerged as the fourth major hub of an Afghan-led network operating across Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, and Chhattisgarh.

title: Hundreds of Israel's Ex-Security Officials Urge Trump To Help End Gaza War
content: Hundreds of retired Israeli security officials including former heads of intelligence agencies have urged US President Donald Trump to pressure their own government to end the war in Gaza.

title: China Keeps Buying Oil From Russia And Iran Despite US Pressure
content: US and Chinese officials may be able to settle many of their differences to reach a trade deal and avert punishing tariffs, but they remain far apart on one issue: the US demand that China stop purchasing oil from Iran and Russia.

title: Unable To Fund Son's Engineering Admission Fee, Kerala Man Dies By Suicide
content: A 47-year-old man in Pathanamthitta district of Kerala died by suicide, allegedly after a prolonged financial crisis that prevented him from paying for his son's engineering college admission, local authorities and relatives said on Monday.

title: Jharkhand Declares 3-Day Mourning After Ex-Chief Minister Shibu Soren's Death
content: The Jharkhand government declared 3-day state mourning in honour of former Chief Minister Shibu Soren, who died on Monday morning, according to a statement.

title: How Beijing Is Using Its Students To Control Anti-China Narrative In UK
content: Beijing is reportedly using academics and students of Chinese studies in the United Kingdom to suppress the discussion on issues that are sensitive to the Chinese government.

title: "In This AI Moment...": Sundar Pichai's Advice To Take Advantage Of Transition
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has a message for his employees: take full "advantage" of artificial intelligence to "accomplish more."

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
